page.title: 07Farming.
page.content: We went to the Trout Farm at Brockhollands,Mr Price the owner showed us round.We saw some baby trout about 4cms long they were in the hatching shed and were a month old. Each fish lays 1000 eggs which stay in the hatching shed.The food for the baby trout costs Â£500 per tonne.The breeding fish lay 50,000 eggs yearly, 75% of these eggs survive and hatch, but the baby fish are delicate and will die if the water doesn't have air bubbled through it.The fish are American Rainbow Trout.They are sold as 8oz,12oz,1lb weight.Mr Price sells a lot of fish to hotels.We were given a fish,when we got back to school we drew lots for it.Beth Haverly won it. Elizabeth McGrindle.
